President Obama signed H: R. 4238 into law on 20 May 2016, modernizing language about minority populations in federal statutes.
President Obama didn: t make the words "negro" and "oriental" illegal, nor did he sign a law banning the use of those words among private citizens.
H: R. 4238 updated use of specific terminology in federal law related to minorities.
The interpretation that H: R. 4238 banned the words "negro" and "oriental" in the public sphere was inaccurate, as the bill only affected use of the terms in federal law.
